intro: Landolphia ugandensis, commonly known as the Uganda morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces distinctive berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and medicinal studies.
